question:
With reference to the launch of the Prakash portal, consider the following statements:
  1. The portal will aid in coal supply to power plants.
  2. The portal is accessible to the general public.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Prakash portal was launched by the power and coal ministries. It stands for ‘Power Rail Koyla Availability through Supply Harmony’. It is t ensure transparency in coal supply to the power plants. This will help improve coordination among the ministries, coal suppliers, power plants, etc.  Statement 2 is incorrect: The portal will not be accessible to the general public. The portal is for the benefit of the stakeholders in the sector. The stakeholders will be able to track the stocks of coal and also the requirements at various regions.
